description: head of a young man with short dark hair with a bald spot on the top of his head; man's head tilted slighlty downward
dimension:
5 15/16 x 4 1/16 in. (15.08 x 10.32 cm) (sheet, irregular)
19 3/4 x 15 3/4 in. (50.17 x 40.01 cm) (outer frame)
markings: Watermark: eagle with head, small crown, and eye in a circle (45 x 43 mm)--the central part of tripartite tail touching lower circle; circle surmounted by a crown 2 mm above; overall height 62 mm; mark centered on a chain line; lines 25 mm apart and 41 mm apart; close to Woodward 68 (Mantova, Siena, no date); Woodword 72 (Rome, c. 1590); Woodward 75 (Palazzo Farnese, Rome, 1602); close to Briquet 209 (Verona, 1582-96, essay states mark common in Bologna, end of the 16th century, called \"impérial\"); La Chapelle [in C. Loisel 2004], fig. 16, Louvre INV 7732 (Agostino Carracci study for an unknown frieze, Bologna or Rome)
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 3, 1995, no. 156, as Bolognese school, c. 1600, for £1,176.25, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1995-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Portrait of a Young Man
